Class Print

  • java.lang.Object
    • Print
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Printable

    public class Print
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.print.Printable
    Used to create methods that will print text for the highscore menu.
    Version:
    1.0, May 15, 2014
    Author:
    Daniel Chen modified by Richard Dang and Benson Guo

      • println

        public void println(java.lang.String text)
        Adds the string passed into the parameter to the list that will be printed and a blank line. Use like System.out.print (String)
        Parameters:
        text - String: stores the string to print

      • startPrinting

        public boolean startPrinting()
        Use to start the actual printer printing
        Parameters:
        p - PrinterJob: Allows access to PrinterJob methods.
        e - reference: Allows access to PrinterException methods.
        Returns:
        true if there is no print exception, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException - Thrown to indicate an error when printing.

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics g,
        java.awt.print.PageFormat pf,
        int page)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        Required for the Printable interface. Prints the text in Courier font and adds a logo.
        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Parameters:
        g-Graphics - variable passed in as parameter.
        pf-PageFormat - variable passed in as parameter.
        page-int - variable passed in for page.
        border-Rectangle2D - variable for border.
        s-String - variable for for each loop.
        g2d-Graphics2D - variable for drawing.
        y-integer - used for text spacing.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException and PrinterException.
        tetristryName-BufferedImage - variable for Tetristry Name image.
        tetristrLogo-BufferedImage - variable for Tetristry Logo.
        Returns:
        final int instance to check if there is or is not a page to print.
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException - Thrown to indicate an error when printing.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indicate an error when reading image file.
